column1: After summarizing the seven questions put by Freud in his 1937 paper 'Analysis terminable and interminable', the author reports on the case of a female patient in whose second analysis four hindrances emerged: the complexity of dealing with several traumas; a preverbal main trauma that impeded progress; the problematic need for a permanent auxiliary ego to perform certain psychical functions; and the strong resistance to analysis of her sexual inhibitions.
